definitions.definition: ( music ) A note formerly used in music, one half the length of a large , twice that of a breve .
( programming ) A long integer variable, twice the size of an int , two or four times the size of a short , and half of a long long .
examples: A long is typically 64 bits in a 32-bit environment.

definitions.definition: ( finance ) An entity with a long position in an asset; for example, a trader or investor possessing an amount of a company's shares.
examples: Every uptick made the longs cheer.

definitions.definition: ( finance ) A long-maturity security, such as a ten- or twenty-year bond.
( Oxbridge , dated ) Clipping of long vacation ( “ summer vacation ” ) .
